DOC.brief_summary: Study objectives determine efficacy , safety tolerability bright light treatment Parkinson 's Disease ( PD ) patient daytime sleepiness . Thirty PD patient enrol equally randomized bright light dim-red light treatment . Objective ( actigraphy ) subjective ( sleep logs/scales ) sleep measure collect baseline intervention phase study . The primary outcome measure change Epworth Sleepiness Scale ( ESS ) compare bright light treatment dim-red light treatment . Secondary outcome measure include Multiple Sleep Latency Test ( MSLT ) , global Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index ( PSQI ) score , Parkinson 's Disease Sleep Scale ( PDSS ) score , actigraphy measure . A variety exploratory analyse examine effect bright light treatment fatigue , depression , quality life , cognition , motor disability . Hypothesis : Bright light exposure diminish daytime sleepiness improve night-time sleep PD patient daytime sleepiness .
